title: Gun trafficking: track gun purchases and seizures
name: Gun trafficking: track gun purchases and seizures
description: This interactive map is based on documents amassed by reporter Dan Freedman for his story Smuggled Guns: the Bigger the Better, which ran May 29 in the Houston Chronicle. Freedman surveyed 44 gun trafficking cases involving 165 defendants in U.S. jurisdictions along the border. From U.S. court documents, Freedman extracted a list of 1,600 guns by brand name. All were weapons purchased in the Southwest for transit to Mexico and that nation’s violent drug cartels. Most of the weapons were either sent to Mexico or intercepted en route. The map, prepared by reporter-researcher Will Tucker, breaks down each purchase documented in the court indictments and criminal complaints and, if known, shows where in Mexico the weapons ended up. With the ATF’s Operation Fast and Furious now in the headlines,  the Houston Chronicle presents the survey data in an interactive format that allows readers to view and comment.

properties.name: 64 Century Arms WASR10 AK-47 rifles

properties.name: 28 FN Herstal Five-Seven pistols
properties.description: Sold to defendant Uriel Patino from Nov. 27, 2009 to June 18, 2010. *This purchase may have been monitored by agents of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives as part of Operation Fast and Furious, which used controversial investigative techniques to follow weapons purchases and link them to Mexican drug cartel higher ups. Agents lost track of guns, two of which were involved in the shooting death of Border Patrol agent Brian Terry in December 2010. The Justice Department inspector general's office is investigating.

The conspiracy involved the Columbus, NM chief of police--Angelo Vega--and the mayor of Columbus--Eddie Espinoza. Conspirator Ian Garland owned and operated the store, Chaparral Guns.

properties.name: Siezed: 201 Century Arms WASR10 AK-47s
properties.description: Two illegal immigrants, Jose Beltran-Bermudez and Yazmin Arvayo-Palafox, were indicted in Arizona Feb. 9, 2011, for possessing 201 Century Arms WASR10 7.62X39mm AK-47 type rifles. The weapons were seized in Laredo, Texas.

properties.name: Seized: 20 Century Arms GP1975 AK-47s
properties.description: Two illegal immigrants, Jose Beltran-Bermudez and Yazmin Arvayo-Palafox, were indicted in Arizona Feb. 9, 2011, for possessing 20 Century Arms GP1975 AK-47 type rifles. The weapons were seized in Laredo, Texas.

properties.name: Seized: 5 Century Arms Draco AK-47 pistols
properties.description: Two illegal immigrants, Jose Beltran-Bermudez and Yazmin Arvayo-Palafox, were indicted in Arizona Feb. 9, 2011, for possessing 5 Century Arms Draco 7.62X39mm AK-47 type pistols. The weapons were seized in Laredo, Texas.

properties.name: Seized: 1 FN Herstal Five-Seven pistol
properties.description: recovered in Mexico City by authorities investigating a murder. The serial number traced back to the FN Herstal Five-Seven pistol sold to Ramon Gandara on Aug. 1, 2010.

properties.name: Siezed: 1 Beretta 9 mm pistol
properties.description: Authorities recovered 1 Beretta 9 mm pistol following a drug cartel battle in Zacapa, Guatemala on March 25, 2008. The weapon was traced back to a purchase by defendant Selenne Garcia Patlan on December 22, 2007.

properties.name: Seized: 1 Bushmaster .223 rifle
properties.description: Mexican authorities recovered 1 Bushmaster .223 rifle that was traced back to defendant John Philip Hernandez after an incident in which a businessman was kidnapped and murdered.

properties.name: Seized: 1 Bushmaster .223 rifle
properties.description: Mexican Authorities recovered 1 Bushmaster .223 rifle following an incident known as "the Acapulco Police Massacre," in which more than a dozen assailants with cartel affiliations executed 4 police officers and 3 secretaries. The weapon was traced back to defendant John Philip Hernandez's purchase at Academy Sports and Outdoors #19 in Houston, Tex.

properties.name: Seized: 1 Bushmaster .223 rifle
properties.description: Mexican authorities recovered 1 Bushmaster .223 rifle in an overturned vehicle that wastraced back to defendant John Philip Hernandez's purchase at Carter's Country #1 in Houston, Tex.

properties.name: Seized: five Century Arms WASR-10 AK-47 rifles
properties.description: U.S. Customs and Border Protection officers discovered the guns in defendant Ernesto Gonzales-Reyes' vehicle as he was attempting to cross the border into Mexico on Mar. 20, 2010.

properties.name: Seized: 1 Bushmaster .223 rifle
properties.description: Mexican authorities recovered the gun following an incident in which 11 suspected "Zetas"--members of an armed group with cartel connections--assaulted police officers. The weapon was traced back to a purchase by defendant Juan Pablo Gutierrez from Carter's Country #2 in Houston, Tex.

properties.name: Seized: 1 Bushmaster .223 rifle
properties.description: Mexican authorities seized a Bushmaster .223 rifle that was traced back to defendant John Philip Hernandez's purchase at Carter's Country #1 in Houston, Tex.

properties.name: Seized: 1 Bushmaster .223 rifle
properties.description: Mexican Authorities recovered 1 Bushmaster .223 rifle following an incident in which "Los Zetas," an armed group with cartel affiliations, opened fire on Mexican army officials at the Botanical Gardens.

properties.name: Seized: 1 Century Arms WASR10 AK-47 rifle
properties.description: Mexican authorities recovered an AK-47 rifle on June 12, 2010, that was traced back to a purchase made at Outdoor America in Oklahoma City, Okla by defendant "F.J.R."

properties.name: Seized: 1 Beretta 9 mm pistol
properties.description: Mexican law enforcement recovered a Beretta 9 mm pistol on Aug. 14, 2008 that was traced back to defendant Joel Arizmendiz's purchase at Pistol Parlour in Mesa, Ariz.

properties.name: Seized: 1 Century Arms WASR10 AK-47 rifle
properties.description: Mexican authorities recovered an AK-47 rifle on Aug. 11, 2010, that was traced back to a purchase made at Outdoor America in Oklahoma City, Okla by defendant "F.J.R."

properties.name: Seized: 6 Romarm GP WASR-10 AK-47 rifles
properties.description: Immigration and Customs Enforcement seized six AK-47 rifles after defendants Begmar Ivan Ruiz-Zuniga and Miguel Angel Dominguez illegally exported the weapons across the border into Mexico on March 19, 2008.

properties.name: Seized: 1 Beretta 9 mm pistol
properties.description: Mexican law enforcement recovered one Beretta 9 mm pistol seven months after it was purchased by Juan Pablo Gutierrez at Carter's Country #2 in Houston, Tex.

properties.name: Seized: 2 Bushmaster .223 rifles
properties.description: Both Bushmaster rifles purchased by defendant Juan Pablo Gutierrez at Carter's Country # 1 in Houston, Tex. were recovered by Mexican law enforcement six months later. The weapons were among an arsenal connected to 20 suspected kidnappers and narcotics traffickers.

properties.name: Seized: 1 Baretta 9 mm pistol
properties.description: Mexican law enforcement recovered one Beretta 9 mm pistol eight months after it was purchased by Juan Pablo Gutierrez at Carter's Country #2 in Houston, Tex.

properties.name: Zacapa, Guatemala
properties.description: Zacapa, Guatemala
